Guideline: Use Regular glass for most cases
Description: Regular glass adapts to content beneath
Don't: Use Clear glass without proper background

Description: Clear glass over photos and videos
Do: Use .glassEffect(.clear) with dimming layer over media
Don't: Use Clear glass over varying content

Do: Use vibrancy or solid colors on glass layers
Don't: Put glass views on top of other glass

Do: Wrap related glass elements in container
Don't: Let overlapping glass sample each other

Do: Assign matching IDs in same namespace
Don't: Create unconnected glass elements that should morph

Do: Apply tint to primary action buttons only
Use accentColor or system colors for tint

Code Good: @Namespace var ns; ForEach { item.glassEffect().glassEffectID(item.id, in: ns) }

Do: Apply glass to nav bars tab bars FABs
Don't: Apply glass to content lists tables
Code Bad: List { ForEach(items) { $0.glassEffect() } } // content shouldn't be glass

Description: iOS 26 tab bars are floating glass
Do: Use default TabView behavior in iOS 26
System handles automatically test with setting
Code Good: Test with Settings > Accessibility > Reduce Transparency ON

Description: Text must be readable on glass
Do: System adapts text contrast automatically verify in testing
Code Good: Test text readability in light and dark modes over various backgrounds

Do: Trust system performance rely on Metal
Don't: Add custom blur effects over glass
Add manual checks for device capability
Code Bad: if oldDevice { noGlass() } else { glass() } // system handles this
